meanings.definition: To move or travel in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The little bird will immew towards the bright sun.
meanings.sent2: I immew to school every morning on the yellow bus.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel decided to immew up the tall tree for a better view.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts immewed through her mind like a river flowing swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The river immews steadily towards the vast ocean, never looking back.

meanings.definition: To be present in a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The cat will immew under the cozy blanket for a nap.
meanings.sent2: I immew at the park every weekend to play with my friends.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to immew into the closed room unnoticed.
meanings.sent4: His laughter immews through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The stars immew in the night sky, twinkling brightly above.

meanings.definition: To be involved in a particular activity or situation.
meanings.sent1: She will immew in the dance competition next week.
meanings.sent2: I immew in the school play as the lead character.
meanings.sent3: The curious child tried to immew in the adult conversation, but no one noticed.
meanings.sent4: His mind immews in the world of imagination, creating endless stories.
meanings.sent5: The colors immew in the painting, blending beautifully on the canvas.
